|ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = F4:6D:04 |oui = F4:6D:04 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = CFE;;; |stockos = Linux;;; |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = ASUS |defaultssid_regex = ^ASUS$ |default_ch = |manuf = SGE |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = FreshTomato, Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt (Was), Tomato (Shibby) |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 07/19/2011 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B002X788V6 |asin_country = |asin2 = B00GBV4NOG |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 28 |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== *Powerful and wide coverage with 5 dBi antenna. *Bandwidth allocation and access control with 4 SSIDs. *No more dead spots at home with repeater mode. *Easy wireless printing by All-in-One printer server. This device is based on the [https://www.broadcom.com/products/wireless/wireless-lan-infrastructure/bcm5356x BCM5356U] system-on-a-chip (SoC, operating at 333MHz MIPS 74K) from [[Broadcom]], as was its successor device in the [[ASUS RT-N10 series|RT-N10 Series]], the [[ASUS RT-N10U B]]. At the time of its release, it was the least expensive platform for consumer-grade wireless routers in their product lineup. :The default clock of the BCM5356U in this unit seems to be 300MHz. OEM: [[SGE]] ([http://www.twsz.com Shenzhen Gongjin Electronics Co.,Ltd.]) *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/asus/rt-n10u ''Asus RT-N10U'' on the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] ==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== * [http://www.foxnetwork.ru/index.php/en/component/content/article/36-reviews/92-asus-rt-n10u.html ''Asus RT-N10U'' Rewieved on '''FoxNetwork'''] (w/ low-res internal shots) :F4:6D:04 OUI ===Forum threads=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=152672 ''Asus RT-N10U'' on the '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://wl500g.info/showthread.php?t=28297&langid=3 '''wl500g.info''' thread about the device] (RU) - covers :overclocking the CPU to @500MHz and upgrading the [http://wl500g.info/showthread.php?28297-Asus-RT-N10U-N10UB-%F1-%EF%F0%EE%F8%E8%E2%EA%EE%E9-%EE%F2-%FD%ED%F2%F3%E7%E8%E0%F1%F2%EE%E2&p=246107#post246107 RAM to 64MB] 
nvram set clkfreq=480,160,80 # +8% CPU or
nvram set clkfreq=500,200,100 # +25% CPU
nvram commit
reboot

Jan 1 04:00:02 kernel: CPU: BCM5357 rev 1 at 480 MHz
Jan 1 04:00:02 kernel: Using 240.000 MHz high precision timer

system type	: Broadcom BCM5357 chip rev 1 pkg 8
processor	: 0
cpu model	: MIPS 74K V4.9
BogoMIPS	: 239.10
